quest.name: Heart of Ice
journal: Moghan is gazing meaningfully at the path to Zenith...

A well-rested Moghan declares that the winds have turned in your favor. After once more instructing you on how to use the horn to summon Hraesvelgr, the moogle bids you a hurried farewell, apparently keen to return to Moghome. You cannot imagine why. Follow the path to Zenith, and blow the horn on the top floor of the palace.

Hraesvelgr answers the call of the horn, but is displeased to find that his sanctuary has been invaded by the children of man. After scornfully dismissing Ysayle's claims to be Shiva reborn, he rebuffs your calls for peace, and recounts the tale of his brood-sister Ratatoskr's murder and the treachery of King Thordan. Man, he concludes, has brought nothing but misery to dragonkind. With that, the immense creature flies away, leaving you to ponder the cost of Nidhogg's eternal quest for vengeance. Trouble Alphinaud for his thoughts on this ill-starred encounter.

Though Hraesvelgr revealed much that was hidden about Ishgard's bloody history, Alphinaud is crushed by the failure of your mission. With your hopes for peace shattered, it is time to consider more desperate measures...
objectives: Blow the horn on the top floor of Zenith.

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: The campfire was so cozy... I must have fallen asleep, kupo.

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: But do you feel how the winds have shifted!? They will have borne Hraesvelgr back to the skies above Zenith─I'm sure of it!

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: This is your chance to climb to the highest floor of the palace, and summon him with a toot on that shiny horn! So, uh...I-I'll be heading back now, if it's all the same to you. Good luck, kupo! It was nice knowing you!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I trust you are well rested, Forename? Good. If we are to parley with Hraesvelgr, we shall each have need of the full complement of our wits.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Whenever you are ready, Warrior of Light. Full eager am I to gaze upon this great wyrm.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: We must succeed in winning Hraesvelgr to our cause. Lend me your resolve, Saint Shiva...

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: Forename! Y-You're alive! I was worried Hraesvelgr might─ Waaait a moment, kupo. I don't remember hearing any tooting. You haven't summoned him yet...have you? If you haven't, climb to the top of his palace and blow the horn. Oh, and forget what I said. I was rambling. Good luck, kupo!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It is time, Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: Lend me your resolve, Saint Shiva...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hraesvelgr was every bit as awe-inspiring as I imagined. His voice fairly dripped with power─the will behind his words so undeniable that it transcended my ignorance of the dragons' tongue. 'Tis but a pity that I misliked what he said.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: <sigh> So far did we travel─even unto the very heavens themselves─only to be dismissed like unruly children. And far from mitigating this...humiliation, the hidden truths we have learned serve only to prove that our grand mission of peace was destined to fail from the first.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nothing will deter Nidhogg from his course.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: As predicted, Iceheart's faith in the wyrm was misplaced. Which leaves us with but one recourse. You know I have the right of it, Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: What false god is this Shiva? What manner of phantom have I welcomed into my heart...?

obj.n: Waiting for the Wind to Change
